{{Infobox football biography | name = Donovan Wilson | image = | caption = | fullname = Donovan Junior Wilson{{cite web|title=Retained List 2016-17|url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-released-and-retained-list---2016-17.pdf|publisher=English Premier League|format=PDF|accessdate=13 June 2017}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1997|3|14|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Yate]], England | height = {{height|m=1.8}} | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]]
(on loan from [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]) | clubnumber = | youthyears1 = 200?–2004 | youthclubs1 = Bradley Stoke United | youthyears2 = 2004–2014 | youthclubs2 = [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] | years1 = 2014–2015 | clubs1 = [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2014–2015 | clubs2 = → [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015– | clubs3 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018 | clubs4= → [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] (loan) | caps4 = 8 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2018–2019 | clubs5= → [[FC Jumilla|Jumilla]] (loan) | caps5 = 16 | goals5 = 6 | years6 = 2019– | clubs6= → [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] (loan) | caps6 = 0 | goals6 = 0 | club-update = 31 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Donovan Junior Wilson''' (born 14 March 1997) is an English [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[ EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]], on loan from [[Premier League]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. He joined Wolves from [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] in January 2015 following a brief loan spell, and made his first-team debut in February 2017. He spent the second half of the 2017–18 season on loan at [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]]. He spent the first half of the 2018–19 season on loan at Spanish club [[FC Jumilla|Jumilla]] and joined Exeter City on loan for the second half of the season. ==Career== ===Bristol Rovers=== Wilson began his career at [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]], signing a one-year deal at the age of 17 in May 2014; he had spent ten years at the club's academy after signing from Bradley Stoke United at the age of seven.{{cite news| title=Donovan Wilson signs a pro-contract with Rovers|publisher=Bristol Rovers F.C| url=http://www.bristolrovers.co.uk/news/article/donovan-wilson-pro-contract-1565051.aspx|accessdate=12 January 2018| date=27 November 2014}} He made the bench at the [[Memorial Stadium (Bristol)|Memorial Stadium]] during the [[2014–15 Bristol Rovers F.C. season|2014–15]] [[National League (division)|Conference Premier]] promotion winning season, but did not make it onto the pitch for the "Pirates".{{Soccerway|donovan-wilson/368463}} Manager [[Darrell Clarke]] reportedly had planned to give him his debut in one match before realising he had already made his three allotted substitutions.{{cite news|title=Striker delighted to extend Wolves stay|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/academy/201634-next-generation-donovan-wilson/|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=wolves.co.uk|date=4 March 2016|language=en}} ===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== Wilson initially joined [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in a loan deal in November 2014, before a permanent transfer for an undisclosed fee was finalised once the January transfer window opened.{{cite news| title=Wolves land Donovan Wilson permanently|publisher=Express & Star| url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2015/01/07/wolves-land-donovan-wilson-permanently/|accessdate=12 January 2018| date=7 January 2015}} He played three [[EFL Trophy]] matches for the [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. Development Squad and Academy|under-23 team]] in the [[2016–17 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2016–17]] season, and scored in the 4–0 win over [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] at the [[Crown Ground]] on 8 November.{{cite news|title=Checkatrade Trophy (Sky Sports)|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/wolves-u21-vs-accrington/367385|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=SkySports|date=6 November 2016|language=en}} He signed a new 18-month contract in December 2016.{{cite news|title=New contracts for Wolves trio|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2016/12/22/new-contracts-for-wolves-trio/|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=Express and Star|date=22 December 2016|language=en}} He made his first-team debut for Wolves in the [[FA Cup]] on 18 February 2017, coming on as a 76th-minute substitute for [[Andreas Weimann]] in a 2–0 defeat to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at [[Molineux Stadium|Molineux]].{{cite news| title=Wolves 0–2 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38940092|accessdate=12 January 2018| date=18 February 2017}} Manager [[Paul Lambert]] said that he had put Wilson on the bench because of his pace, though he remained behind fellow youngsters [[Bright Enobakhare]], [[Connor Ronan]] and [[Morgan Gibbs-White]] in the first-team pecking order.{{cite news|title=Donovan Wilson backed by Paul Lambert to succeed at Wolves|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2017/02/22/donovan-wilson-backed-by-paul-lambert-to-succeed-at-wolves/|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=Express and Star|date=22 February 2017|language=en}} Wilson made his [[EFL Championship]] debut on 14 April, coming on as a 76th-minute substitute for [[Jón Daði Böðvarsson]] in a 2–0 home defeat to [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].{{cite news|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 0-2 Brighton & Hove Albion|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39522687|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=BBC Sport|date=14 April 2017}} He scored his first senior goal on 23 August 2017, in a 2–0 victory over [[Premier League]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at [[St Mary's Stadium|St Mary's]] in the Second Round of the [[EFL Cup]].{{cite news| title=Southampton 0–2 Wolves|accessdate=12 January 2018|publisher=BBC Sport| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40944673| date=23 August 2017}} He signed a new three-year contract two months later.{{cite news|last1=Judah|first1=Nathan|title=Wolves duo Donovan Wilson and Christian Herc sign new deals|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2017/10/31/wolves-duo-donovan-wilson-and-christian-herc-sign-new-deals/|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=Express and Star|date=31 October 2017|language=en}} On 11 January 2018, he joined [[EFL League Two]] side [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] on loan until the end of the [[2017–18 Port Vale F.C. season|2017–18]] season.{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Michael|title=Port Vale sign striker Donovan Wilson on loan from Wolves|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/port-vale-sign-striker-donovan-1042585|accessdate=11 January 2018|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=11 January 2018}} The "Valiants" had previously attempted to sign Wilson on loan the previous summer.{{cite news|last1=Spiers|first1=Tim|title=Wolves winger Jordan Graham joins Fulham on loan|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2017/08/31/wolves-winger-jordan-graham-joins-fulham-on-loan/|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=Express and Star|date=31 August 2017|language=en}} Manager [[Neil Aspin]] said there had been competition from others clubs to sign the youngster.{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Michael|title=Port Vale boss delighted to see off rivals for Wolves striker Donovan Wilson|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/port-vales-neil-aspin-delighted-1044798|accessdate=12 January 2018|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=11 January 2018}} On 17 March, Wilson scored his first goal in the [[English Football League]] in a 2–2 draw with [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] at [[Vale Park]].{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Michael|title=Comment as Port Vale edge towards safety and fans vent frustration at owner|url=https://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/comment-port-vale-edge-towards-1353576|accessdate=18 March 2018|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=18 March 2018}} On 31 August 2018, Wilson joined [[Segunda División B]] club [[FC Jumilla|Jumilla]] on loan, along with eight Wolves teammates.{{cite news |title=Wolves send nine player on loan to FC Jumilla |url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/academy/20180831-wolves-send-nine-player-on-loan-to-fc-jumilla/ |accessdate=11 September 2018 |work=wolves.co.uk |date=31 August 2018 |language=en}} He scored six goals in 16 league games for the club and was praised by manager [[Leonel Pontes]].{{cite news |last1=Dicken |first1=Alex |title=Donovan Wilson scouting report: Wolves ace continues to excite in Spain |url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/donovan-wilson-scouting-report-wolves-15284121 |accessdate=31 January 2019 |work=Birmingham Mail |date=15 October 2018}} Wilson said that "over here I’ve been playing game after game, and I’m pleased that I’m getting more minutes into my legs, getting me fitter, stronger, so it’s been a really good experience."{{cite news |last1=Spiers |first1=Tim |title=Donovan Wilson learning worldwide language of football |url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2018/11/23/donovan-wilson-learning-worldwide-language-of-football/ |accessdate=31 January 2019 |work=Express and Star |date=23 November 2018 |language=en}} On 31 January 2019, he returned to England and joined League Two side [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] on loan until the end of the [[2018–19 Exeter City F.C. season|2018–19]] season, replacing departing loanee striker [[Tristan Abrahams]].{{cite news |last1=Pilnick |first1=Brent |title=Donovan Wilson: Exeter City loan forward from Wolverhampton Wanderers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47072367 |accessdate=31 January 2019 |date=31 January 2019}} ==Personal life== Wilson was born in England and is of Jamaican descent.{{cite web|url=https://www.zerozero.pt/player.php?id=431898;&redirm=1|title=Donovan Wilson :: Donovan Wilson :: Port Vale|website=www.zerozero.pt}} ==Style of play== Wilson is a pacey [[Forward (association football)|forward]]. ==Career statistics== {{updated|31 January 2019.}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club Development Squad and Academy|Wolverhampton Wanderers U23]] |[[2016–17 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2016–17]] |—||—||—||—||—||—||—||3{{efn|name=efl|Appearances in the [[EFL Trophy]]}}||1||3||1 |- |[[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Port Vale F.C. season|2017–18]] |[[EFL League Two|League Two]] |8||1||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||8||1 |- |[[FC Jumilla|Jumilla]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Segunda División B#Group 4|2018–19]]{{Soccerway|donovan-wilson/368463}} |[[Segunda División B|Segunda División B – Group 4]] |16||6||0||0||0||0||0||0||16||6 |- |[[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Exeter City F.C. season|2018–19]] |League Two |0||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||0||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !25!!7!!1!!0!!2!!1!!3!!1!!31!!9 |} {{notelist}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Soccerbase|77814}} {{Exeter City F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wilson, Donovan}} [[Category:1997 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Yate]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:English people of Jamaican descent]] [[Category:Black English sportspeople]] [[Category:Association football forwards]] [[Category:Bristol Rovers F.C. players]] [[Category:Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. players]] [[Category:Port Vale F.C. players]] [[Category:FC Jumilla players]] [[Category:Exeter City F.C. players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:Segunda División B players]] [[Category:English expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Spain]]
